snippet: The Supreme Court heard two cases Monday that may further refine a ruling  that said the plaintiffs in a 2011 class action against Wal-Mart did not have enough in common to band together to sue the retailer.
abstract: Supreme Court hears two cases about how much evidence courts must demand before allowing plaintiffs to band together in class actions; Amgen case concerns securities fraud, and Comcast case concerns antitrust; cases may further refine ruling that said plaintiffs in a 2011 class action against Wal-Mart did not have enough in common to band together to sue the retailer.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court heard two cases Monday that may further refine a ruling  that said the plaintiffs in a 2011 class action against Wal-Mart did not have enough in common to band together to sue the retailer.

headline.main: Supreme Court Hears 2 Cases Over Class Actions
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Hears 2 Cases Over Class Actions
